definition: to succeed/to finish/to complete/to accomplish/to become/to turn into/to be all right/OK!/one tenth
abbr. for 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1]

sentences.english: In chapter two, the background of the Notes of Classical Chinese is demonstrated.
sentences.chinese: 第二章论述了《古文观止》成书的背景。

sentences.english: Historical Pinghua has much bearing on the novel Romance of the Three Kingdoms.
sentences.chinese: 讲史平话与《三国演义》成书的关系十分密切。

sentences.english: All that remained was printing and hand-binding the books…
sentences.chinese: 接下来就只剩下列印和手工装钉成书。

sentences.english: There are various problems in Selections, but it was not compiled in haste.
sentences.chinese: 《文选》存在着种种问题，然非仓促成书。

sentences.english: It's about eight years after Comus.
Many plays which are successful in the theatre are never printed as a book to be read.
sentences.chinese: 很多在剧院表演成功的戏剧却从没印成书供人们阅读。

sentences.english: You'd better temper yourself, while not write your books only by imagining.
sentences.chinese: 你尚需闯练，仅靠想象是写不成书的。

sentences.english: Facts alone do notcompose a book.
sentences.chinese: 单有事实是无法成书的。

sentences.english: In the second chapter, the author discusses the edition and writing course of Nv Xian Wai Shi.
sentences.chinese: 第二章主要探讨了《女仙外史》的版本和成书过程。

sentences.english: The first chapter is about the creation time and the spread situation of"Accounts of Avenging Spirits".
sentences.chinese: 第一章，介绍《冤魂志》的成书及流传情况。

sentences.english: At the end of Ming dynasty, records of vocal music are spreaded abroad to Japan.
sentences.chinese: 明末的唱乐记录还流传到日本刊印成书。

sentences.english: These materials have been digested into a book.
sentences.chinese: 这些材料已被汇编成书。

sentences.english: In the second part, we focus on sources of qian tai wo zuan.
sentences.chinese: 第二部分，主要论述了《虔台倭纂》成书的资料来源。

sentences.english: The works by the Ming quarter will be collated into a book, widely circulated.
sentences.chinese: 遗作经季会明等整理成书，广泛流传。

sentences.english: Again , that book was my fathers short stories compiled into a book.
sentences.chinese: 再一次，是用家父的故事结集成书，这是第二本书。

definition: to set in print/to diffuse/to publish
to go to press/to submit for printing
to send (a manuscript) to the press
to compose (a piece of writing)/to write/(written) work/writer
